OverconstrainedError.summary: The OverconstrainedError interface of the Media Capture and Streams API indicates that the set of desired capabilities for the current cannot currently be met. When this event is thrown on a MediaStreamTrack, it is muted until either the current constraints can be established or until satisfiable constraints are applied.

OverconstrainedErrorConstraint.summary:
The constraint read-only property of the
interface returns the constraint that was supplied
in the constructor, meaning the constraint that was not satisfied.

OverconstrainedErrorOverconstrainedError.summary:
The OverconstrainedError() constructor
creates a new object which indicates that the set of
desired capabilities for the current cannot currently be
met. When this event is thrown on a MediaStreamTrack, it is muted until
either the current constraints can be established or until satisfiable constraints are
applied.
